text: what's up guys Zhu Ben ski here and
today I'd like to talk to you a little
bit about a country that I did not enjoy
so much and that nation is called Brunei
a quick disclaimer that this video is
based entirely off my own thoughts and
personal experiences I know many people
who have been to Barnard before and
liked it but from my own perspective I
did not enjoy it so much for relevancy I
went to Brunei in early 2014 way before
I made videos when my hair looked like
this and when my perspectives of the
world were not as wide as they are now
but nonetheless it's a country that I
think about often if you've never heard
of Brunei before it's a tiny oil-rich
nation in Southeast Asia on Borneo
island surrounded by Malaysia and
Indonesia about two-thirds of his
500,000 residents identified as Muslim
and is considered to be the most
observant Islamic nation in Southeast
Asia let's begin with the good Brunei
has one of the most stunning national
parks I'd ever been to called Lulu
timber owned I took a day trip there and
had a wonderful time
there are also some impressive buildings
in the capital city and the people for
the most part are very friendly just
like I found in Malaysia that's about
all the nice things I can say about
Brunei
so when I arrived on my very first day
in the capital city club Bhangarh Seri
Begawan I was super excited to visit the
amazingly beautiful mosque so I went
inside I was dressed in my proper attire
I took off my shoes for respect and
after five minutes of being inside I was
aggressively kicked out by two locals
for reasons that I don't know why I was
there on a Monday afternoon and it
wasn't during prayer time I was just
like any other tourist trying to check
it out and all these guys had to do was
politely tell me to leave and that would
have been fine but I was bullying my way
out the door and that thought cannot
leave my mind to this day it didn't take
me long to realize that Brunei has
horrifying human rights laws in fact
they recently implemented a law that you
can be stoned to death if you're gay
stoned to death there's also a heavy
discrimination against non-muslims which
might explain why I was kicked out of
that mosque you see Brunei has no
freedom of speech no freedom of press
and everything is controlled by the
government in addition the level of
corruption in this country amuses me
Brunei is sitting on lots of oil for
such a small country and hence it's rich
one of the world's richest men is the
sultan hassan al bokya his net worth is
20 billion dollars yet the country looks
like it's still stuck in the 80s and his
people are suffering in poverty if the
Sultan spread just half of his wealth to
Brunei on citizens they did get a check
for twenty three thousand two hundred
and fifty five dollars oh yeah
and maybe he could also donate one of
his six hundred Rolls Royces as well
things like a strict alcohol ban slow
Wi-Fi and a lack of anything to do
aren't reasons to dislike a place of
course but they certainly don't
contribute much either I will say that
most of the locals are warm and genuine
almost as if they don't know they're
living in such a dark regime or maybe
they ignore it in any case it's safe to
say that I will not be returning to
Brunei any time soon and if you guys are
planning to go then I would advise you
to think twice
[Music]
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I planned to visit every
country in the world
